project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-10356].
  {panel}

During JIRA Agile (GreenHopper) installation, the custom fields added are created in the default locale. Since JIRA supports I18N, it would be nice to have JIRA Agile to also support internationalisation.

h3.Workaround
The field names and descriptions could be modified using the following steps:
# Unlock the locked field - [How to unlock a Locked field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/How+to+unlock+a+Locked+field]
# Edit the field to the required label - [Configuring a Custom Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA061/Configuring+a+Custom+Field]
# Remember to again lock the unlocked fields to avoid modifications.

Note: The custom field names may also need to be updated to the new language text in other features like filter queries.
fields.summary: As a user in a global company I would like to have internationalisation of JIRA Agile custom fields

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

Currently the only option for column constraint is the issue count.
It would be very useful to be able to select other criteria e.g. Remaining Estimate or story points. These would be a better to gage the actual workload  .

Or at least being able to display the sum of these values in the column heading.

Thank you.

Regards,
Oleg.
fields.summary: Column constraint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

Consider this scenario.
We have a board with filter show only story issue types.
Stories have sub-tasks, but we not showing them as the purpose of the board is to track the progress of the stories. However when you click on the story to see the details, the details view pane does not display the sub-tasks saying that they are filtered by the board query. 

Our view is that board query should not be used when displaying selected item's details.

Thank you.

Regards,
Oleg
fields.summary: Issue filter on kanban boards

It is very difficult to read.

When using IE8 version 8.0.6, navigating to some pages in JIRA Agile  will produce blank screens:

- Burndown Chart (See screenshot).

Also, creating a Board will hang after submission. Despite that, the board is created successfully.

h6.Workaround

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When viewing the wallboard gadget as a slideshow, the size of the viewable portion is automatically sized to the display.   The problem we have is that we are attempting to show this on an Android display on a 60" TV.  The URL bar consumes part of the initial space on the screen, and the wallboard will take that into account when it is being sized.   If I scroll the view up, the URL bar does disappear (normal Android behaviour), but that means that there is now an empty black band at the bottom of the screen.  I am suggesting that the vertical height of the slideshow object be somewhat longer than the available screen so that when scrolled up that small amount, the entire display is still being used.
fields.summary: I would like the wallboard gadget to be sized larger than the visible screen

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In our environment we have the Agile wallboard gadget being displayed on a 60" screen.   We would like to be able to scale down the contents of the gadget by some percentage value in order to fit more information onto the display.  (See also: GHS-10342)  This would allow for even greater vertical density of the cards.
fields.summary: I would like the wallboard gadget to be scalable

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: My users have expressed their dissatisfaction that the card size on the Agile board consumes more vertical space than is necessary to display the basic information, in most cases.  I would like to be able to configure the vertical size of the card, perhaps in terms of the number of lines of text that it will display.  This will allow for greater (vertical) density of cards on a board.
fields.summary: I would like the card (vertical) size on the Agile Board to be adjustable

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

# open the /rest/api/2/field resource on JIRA OnDemand
# find the Epic Link field schema. The schema is
{"type":"array","items":"string","custom":"com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-epic-link","customId":10600}
# open /rest/api/2/issue/<issue key> for an issue that has an Epic Link field populated. 
# find the Epic Link field

Result: A string is shown, whereas the schema says that an array should be shown.

Expected result: The epic link field can only ever contain one value, so the schema shouldn't state that it contains an array.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a Web or Direct Link to an issue, and if the Epic Link is a field it will generate an error. This also affects the [Clone Plus|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.jira.clone-plus] plugin.

{panel:title=Solution}
We found that the solution to this issue, which was caused by a problem in JIRA, is to upgrade your version of JIRA to 6.3.15 or higher.
{panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a [Direct Link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+via+direct+HTML+links] to an issue with an "Epic Link".
# Navigate to it in the instance.

OR

Attempt to use the Clone+ plugin on an issue that has an "Epic Link".

h3. Expected Results

It works without error.

h3. Actual Results

if Epic Link is a field, then you get the following error:

{code}An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. 57] at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.handleInvocationException(ASTMethod.java:337) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:284) at We would like to create a report with the following information:

h3. Data:
# The sum of the estimated task hours for issues (stories) assigned to the users in the sprint;

With the discontinuation of the JIRA Agile Classic boards, the release-specific burndown chart will not be available for new projects.

The burndown chart should be migrated from the JIRA Agile classic boards into the standard repertoire of JIRA project reports to keep it available for the JIRA users.

It should per fix-version show the burndown based on one of:
- Story points
- Issues Status (especially Open and Closed)
- Time Tracking

As a work around, we determined we could create quick filters in the form of:

in the quick filter while in "plan".  This unfortunately forces you to step though every team member and ask "are you properly loaded ?"

Solution could be as simple as always keeping "unassigned" at the top of the list, as right now it's berried down with the users.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Scrum product owner I need themes to structure the backlog for a better overview of the backlog.

The description of Mike Cohn clearifies, that Themes should be, whald Eipcs are at the moment: a grouping for User Stories (and Epics):
"Finally, “theme” is a collection of user stories. We could put a rubber band around that group of stories I wrote about monthly reporting and we'd call that a “theme.” Sometimes it's helpful to think about a group of stories so we have a term for that."
(http://www.mountaingoatsoftware.com/blog/stories-epics-and-themes)

Acceptance criteria:
- There is a new Issue Type: "Theme"
- Themes are used like Epics today (v6.1): They filter the backlog (User Stories and Epics) and are displayed in an extra column. There is no need that they are affected by quick filters.
fields.summary: Use Themes to filter the backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Scrum product owner I want to find Epics in my Product Backlog in the same list as User Stories, so that I have an overview of the complete backlog and know which parts of it have to be broken down.

Acceptance criteria:
- Epics are displayed in the list of user stories and are filter and sorted just like the stories
- If I click on the epic, the User Stories underneath will be shown
- Epics have a different look than User Stories (colour, Symbol,...?), so that I can visually distinguish them from User Stories
fields.summary: Epics are not filters - Display Epics in the product backlog like User Stories

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a scrum product owner I need to see the details (description, estimation, comments,...) of epics so that I can inform me about the epic and understand better, what the Epic is about.

Acceptance criteria:
- If I click on an Epic in the left column of the agile planning board, it's details will be shown in the right column of the board.
- The epic detail view looks and behaves like the User Story detail view.
fields.summary: Display Epic details on Agile Planning Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a scrum product Owner I habe the need, that Epics are affected by filters as  User Stories are so that I only see big User Stories (called Epics), that belong to the filtered backlog.

Acceptance criteria:
- After I have choosen a quick filter on the agile planning board, in the left column  of the planning board only the epics display, that match to the current filter
- If I deselect a quick filter or no filter is selected, all (open) epics of the backlog will be displayed
fields.summary: Filter Epics like User Stories

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Scrum Product Owner I need better support for Epics on the agile planning board, so that I can structurize my product backlogs in a useful matter.

To better understand the (correct?!) usage of epics, see the definition that Mike Cohn gave us:
"So, “epic” is just a label we apply to a large story. Calling a story an epic can sometimes convey additional meaning. Suppose you ask me if I had time yesterday to write the user stories about the monthly reporting part of the system. “Yes,” I reply, “but they are mostly epics.” That tells you that while I did write them, I didn't get the chance to break most of them down into stories that are probably small enough to implement directly."
(see: http://www.mountaingoatsoftware.com/blog/stories-epics-and-themes)

Given this description, Epics should be used just like user stories, at least on the planning board:
- They should be displayed in the backlog between user stories
- they should show / group their sub User Stories 
- they should be affected by filter as User Stories are
- they should display their details (description, estimation, comments) like User Stories do
fields.summary: Correct usage of Epics and Themes on Agile Planning Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5.Summary
Although we allow users to start Sprints with a Start Date in the past, that information isn't recognized in reporting.

h5.Steps to reproduce
# create a new Sprint and add Issues to it;
# start the Sprint - pick a Start Date in the past;
# see the Burndown Chart and the Sprint Report - no Issues are considered to be in the original scope, and all appear as added at the moment when the Sprint was actually started.

*Expected behaviour:* intuitively, one could assume that the selected Start Date will be resembled in reporting.
At the same time, Issue history does include the information that they were added to the Sprint after the Start Date, so technically, the report is right.

This could be addressed with one of the two solutions:
- make reporting recognize past Sprint Start Dates as the dates when Issues were added to Sprints;
- disable the option to set the Start Date in the past altogether.
fields.summary: Recognize past Sprint Start Date in reporting

fields.description:
The Start Date of Versions in Jira Agile should also update the Start Date in Jira Classic to allow Wallboard gadgets to keep functioning.  In particular, "Agile Classic Cumulative Flow" charts are fundamentally affected.

The workaround is very tedious and annoying, especially if you have multiple Versions on the go.  You have to remember to switch back to Classic mode; expand the relevant versions; and update the Start Dates manually one-by-one while referencing the Jira Agile Start Dates in another window.

In general, Atlassian should properly support Jira Classic Wallboard gadgets, until they are fully replaced by new Jira Agile ones.
fields.summary: Cumulative Flow Diagram incorrect since depends on Classic Start Date

fields.description:
As of now, there is not feature in JIRA Agile that allows users to export the Scrum board Plan Mode into different formats such as .pdf / .xls. The only way for them to get the overview of the board is either by taking a screen shot of the board:
!sprint_1.JPG|thumbnail!

Or on the other hand, make use of JQL to search for a specific sprint (this is not so handy as we can only search for a one specific sprint at one time rather than several sprints that belongs to the specific board)
!sprint_2.JPG|thumbnail!

It will be useful if there is a *one-click* button or feature that allows the user to export the Plan Mode of the board to other formats (eg. the status of all the sprints, including future sprints) in a single document.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to have the ability to export Plan Mode as a PDF

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Setup a vanilla JIRA with JIRA Agile
# Setup a Mixed Case username user in LDAP(eg. Admin)
# Configure JIRA to the LDAP 
# Sync the User to JIRA
# Make sure the user has the right membership
# Login JIRA using the username
# Create a Project and Board(Scrum or Kanban) in JIRA Agile. User would be both Board and Filter owner.
# Go to Board >> Configuration

h4.  Expected Result
The *Filter Share* option should be in the Board Configuration.

h4. Actual Result:
The *Filter Share* option is missing form Board Configuration.

h4. Workaround:
The Filter Owner is still possible to edit the filter sharing option under JIRA's Manage Filter page.

*Current behaviour:*
 There is currently no way of identifying who started a sprint.

*Expected behaviour:*

h4. Workaround

Create automation like [*this one*|https://share.getcloudapp.com/xQunKY41] to log the user who started the sprint. We can also create a rule to send an email to the user who started the sprint. Follow an example in this[ *video.*|https://share.getcloudapp.com/jkuedYmv]

fields.description:
Story Points can no longer be Exported nor do they show up in the Bulk Edit

This issue has happened before. Can you please fix it asap and create a test to make sure that it doesn't happen again. I am really frustrated that you have so many regressions. It is really unprofessional.

To reproduce:
1) Select Issues then Search
2) Add the column 'Story Points'
3) Click Export then Excel (Current Fields)
4) Open the Excel, the Story Point column is not there. 
Actual: The Story Points column is missing from the Export. This is a regression as I was able to do see the Story Point column in the Excel export many times before.
Expected: The Story Points column to be exported

Feel free to contact me. I use these fields a lot and need them available.
Edie Hovermale
(650)245-8996 PST
fields.summary: Story Points can no longer be Exported nor do they show up in the Bulk Edit

fields.description:
We use ranking, so the issues in the backlog in that screen shot is ordered by rank. The problem is displaying only the relevant (e.g. top 10 ranked) issues from each project in the sprint planning mode.
Ideally the backlog could display 10 issues from project A, then 10 issues from project B, and so on, and ignore the hundreds of other issues in those projects.

(y) Ordering by two fields was a very useful tip. The closes I have come now is:
{{updatedDate > -7d and resolution = unresolved and  project in (AAA, BBB, CCC) order by project, rank desc}}

(n) I added {{updatedDate > -7d}} to avoid having hundreds of issues from the first project displayed above the second project. But what I really want is the top ten ranked. Using updatedDate will give several irrelevant issues.
fields.summary: Filter top ten issues from multiple projects in backlog

fields.description:
During JIRA development, our internal systems were deployed with a version of JIRA that had a broken JQL parser.  The effect was to make JIRA Agile's welcome and management pages unusable due to an internal server error.

This suggests three separate problems:
# The JQL parser needs to be fixed
# JIRA should be hardened to avoid exposing plugins to undeclared runtime exceptions if unparsable JQL is encountered in the database.  This is important because the ability of OnDemand customers to export and import to their on premise instance means that they could have created search requests (filters) in the OnDemand instance that the on premise instance cannot yet support.
# JIRA Agile should be hardened against exceptions that occur when trying to retrieve a search request (filter).

This last point is what this issue is meant to cover; the other two are being tracked internally by JIRA development.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile is vulnerable to JQL parse exceptions from JIRA

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Apptio Support Entitlement number (SEN): SEN-2019309 

Our developers like to use Technical Tasks to break down the work involved in a user story.  Unfortunately we can't use them, because they don't show up on the planning tab of a rapid board.  This doesn't make any sense to us - we should be able to see and pull a unit of work onto a sprint.  It shouldn't be hidden by the parent user story.  

When we checked on this earlier we were told this was by design.  
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/108172/planning-sprint-in-greenhopper-6-with-scrum-board-no-subtasks-shown?page=1#251048
This response is not satisfactory and inconsistent with behavior for your JIRA OnDemand product (which does allow you to view Technical Tasks) in planning mode.  Please address this.  

The suggestion that we repurpose Epics to provide this functionality is not a viable option for us.  We already use Epics and it doesn't make sense for us to radically shift how we classify issues to work around what appears to be a bug in your downloadable product.  
Clearly from the above link we're not the only company who wants this fixed.

Ideally (but not required):
1) Tasks should be shown in an hierarchial view under their parent
2) Task points should roll up to a story
Internal reference: SCM-709, SCM-713
fields.summary: Technical Tasks do not show up on the Planning tab of a rapid board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Apptio Support Entitlement number (SEN): SEN-2019309 

Here is a sample repro scenario:
Team ITP creates a Ticket A with in the Sprint 14.01.17 - ITP" on Team ITP Rapid Board.
Team ITP assigns Ticket A to a team member in Reporting team
Reporting team opens 'Team Reporting Rapid Board' and views Ticket A assigned to it under cross team sprint 'Sprint 14.01.17 - ITP'.
Team ITP does not have any visibility into Ticket A on the ITP Rapid Board.
Team ITP searches for Ticket A in JIRA and updates the 'Team' field to 'Planning' . .

Expected Result:
    Ticket A shows up under Sprint 14.01.17 - ITP on Team Reporting Rapid Board
    Ticket A also shows up under Sprint 14.01.-17 - ITP on Team ITP Rapid Board.

Actual Result:
    Ticket A disappears from Sprint 14.01.17 - ITP on Team Reporting Rapid Board.
    Ticket A shows up under Sprint 14.01.-17 - ITP on Team ITP Rapid Board

Oddly, issue state appears to be a factor as well.  In the above example, tickets in an active state are not shown on the Team Reporting Rapid board when they are active, but when they are in a resolved or closed state they do.
Note - we considered disabling the Team field but found we need it to:
1) Filter out tickets on a Rapid board for resources that are shared across multiple teams
2) Ensure individual team rapid boards with resources on multiple teams have accurate reporting (by filtering out only the bugs that apply to that team). 
Internal reference: SCM-826, SCM-791
fields.summary: JIRA: Team field doesn't work for cross team sprint tickets

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently in the task board, the ranking of the sub-tasks is restricted by the parent issue of those sub-tasks. However, in certain situations it's necessary to have this restriction removed. An example of the use case we have here:

 Call ABC-1: parent call to create a piece of software
 Call ABC-2, ABC-3, ABC-4, ABC-5 (sub-task from ABC-1): all three for the development of different parts of the software, one for customer documentation all assigned to different people
 
The people which the calls ABC-2, ABC-3, ABC-4, ABC-5 assigned see only the assigned calls on there agile boards. There is no chance for the users to get the ABC-2 calls above all other calls without re-ranking the complete call ABC-1 which is assigned to the product owner of the software.

It will be nice to have the flexibility for the users to have their issues ranked based on their own boards instead of having the restriction of the parent issue.
fields.summary: Rank of Sub-tasks regardless to the Parent issue.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It should be possible to order backlogs by other values than the rank, such as a field, what is important for the management-level: the "business value" which specified how important a story is for the company. In my company for example, we need to create sprints ordered by the business-value as we firstly need to realize these stories before any others. 
The current JIRA Agile does not offer this opportunity as it only allows the create a new sprint which is ordered by "rank". This is quite static way to create a new sprint, therefor it would be create to be able to create new sprints with other arrangements, such as ordered by the field "business value" or any other custom-field which a user has created for his stories.

I read in forum, that more people are wishing to have this kind of function.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Order Backlog by "Business Value" - not by "Rank"

fields.description:
Epic Report includes only issues whose current status is one of the Jira default statuses (regardless of whether the issue ever made it into such a default status in the past).  In other words, issues linked to an Epic (as evidenced on the Epic detail screen in Jira), whose status is _not_ one of the default Jira statuses, are excluded from the Epic Report.

E.g., we have custom "New" and "In Grooming" statuses (which occur prior to "Open").  Issues in either of these states that are properly linked to an Epic do not show up in the associated Epic Report.  If we change the status to Open, they do show up in the Epic Report.  If we change the status back to non-default (say "New"), they disappear again from the Epic Report.

-Johnny
fields.summary: Epic Report excludes issues with non-default statuses

fields.description:
As of the current feature of the Kanban board, users are able to release a version which are listed under the *Done* column as a whole. What this means is that every issue that are in the column will be released.

However, it will be good if JIRA Agile can introduce an additional feature that allows users to release version per component. This actually helps to manage releases better in such a way that you might have different components that you would like to release in different versions.

The current workaround that is available is to make use of a separate Kanban board for separate releases per components. If this feature is introduced in Kanban, it will provide more flexibility to version release.
fields.summary: As a Kanban board user, I would like to be able to release the version per Component basis

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The current [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Adding+an+Issue+to+a+Sprint] requires a user to have project permissions:

* 'Edit Issue'
* 'Schedule Issue'

If a user has these permissions and does *not* have 'Administer Projects' permission the issue will be created, but it will not provide the additional link in the temp. pop-up to 'Add to <sprint name>'.  Instead it will be added to the backlog.

Adding the permission to 'Administer Projects' does allow the 'Add to <sprint name> dialog to be shown.

Without the permission a user can still move the issue from backlog into the active sprint, confirming the functionality and permission does exist.

Examples attached of failed event, manual event and successful event (with additional permission).

*Workaround:*
Manually schedule from 'Backlog' to 'Sprint' in Plan mode
or
Add 'Administer Projects' permission to necessary users
fields.summary: Creating and Adding new issue to active sprint does not work with documented project permissions

If you would like to prevent users from doing this, restrict their Project Administrator permissions.{quote} whereas on https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Adding+an+Issue+to+a+Sprint it reads that {quote}You will need to have the 'Edit Issue' permission in the project to which the issue belongs.{quote}

fields.description:
The current functionality of *JIRA Agile / GreenHopper* defines that the right most column is the column that you use to close issues. However, it will be more flexible if users are able to define their own columns for closing issues.

Also, it will be useful if users can also have more than a single column for closing issues. A good use case is per the following:
* A development team is comprised of several members that are responsible for certain tasks
* The board is configured to have columns such as:
** To Do
** In Progress
** Testing Done
** Development Done
* The members that are responsible for Testing is able to complete / close their tasks by moving them to the *Testing Done* column
* On the other hand, members of the Development shall move their tasks to *Development Done* column

This flexibility will help teams to organize their issues and tasks in a better manner.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to have the ability to define the more than one column to close issues

fields.description:
As a Product Owner, I want the stakeholders in my product to be able to rank the issues that they find important to our product independently from other stakeholders. 

Details:
We manage our stakeholders by allowing them to rank their requests in order of importance. Our sales team will have a different list of priorities to our support team for instance. In JIRA Agile Classic, we do this by given them access to a planning board for their issues and associate the context to a Ranking field (e.g. "Sales Rank", "Support Rank", etc.). This allows our stakeholders to drag and drop issues into the order that they find important. These lists are used as input to our sprint planning meeting. The independent ranking fields mean there is no accidental interference between the various stakeholders' lists when moving issues up or down in their own list.

With JIRA Agile, this is no longer possible (due to the fact that there is only one global rank field). We tried this once, but each time a stakeholder changes the ranking of an issue in their list, it has a side effect of changing the rank in other lists (due to the fact the ranking is global). This led to prioritisation chaos. 

The lack of support for our use case(s) forces us to use JIRA Classic. Once JIRA Classic ceases to exist - the way we work will no longer be supported by JIRA at all. We are thus forced to stay on an older version of JIRA. 

We would like to be able to configure a board to have a specific ranking field other than the global ranking field, just like you can in the current Agile Classic view.
fields.summary: Stakeholder Management via Multiple Ranking Fields

fields.description:
It appears that somehow, JIRA/JIRA Agile is able to get into such a state that the Epic-Story Link is duplicated in the issuelinktype table of JIRA database. 

The following SQL query returns more than one row from database:
{code}SELECT * FROM `issuelinktype` WHERE linkname = "Epic-Story Link" 
{code}

*Symptoms*
* JQL queries using linktype will break (See: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Duplicate+Epic-Story+Link+types+in+IssueLinkType+table+causing+errors+in+search+using+has+Epic)
* JIRA and JIRA Agile are unable to retrieve Epic Link data or Epic associations i.e. all issues or stories would appear missing from their epics (See: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/All+Epic+Link+data+appears+lost+after+upgrade).

*Expected Behaviour*
* JIRA/JIRA Agile should be able to prevent or detect and delete this duplicate linktype entries.

Not quite sure if this should be a JIRA or JIRA Agile issue, but I'd leave developers to decide and move this if necessary. It occurred in a JIRA 6.1.4 instance.

*Workaround:*
Please find workarounds to fix the broken data in the KB article links provided under the *Symptoms* section above
fields.summary: Duplicate Epic-Story Link types should be automatically removed from the IssueLinkType table

fields.description:
h4. Actual Behavior:

There seems to be something wrong with the Linked Pages in Agile Sprints.

h4. Expected behavior:

You are able to link pages without any exceptions.

h4. Steps to Reproduce:

In JIRA 6.0.8 with JIRA Agile 6.3.6.1:

- You need to have:
-- Application Link with Confluence (in the test, I had Confluence 5.4.1)
-- JIRA Agile 6.3.6.1

# Go into the Plan mode of Agile, create a Sprint or click on Linked Pages of an existing sprint.
# Search for the page and click on it when you find.
# The following error is displayed:
{code}
An error occured when storing a JSON property {0}
{code}

*In JIRA 6.1.5*, with the same version of JIRA Agile:

While you can use the Linked Page, if you go to Confluence and click on the JIRA link that send you to a Sprint that haven't started, you will see an error that the Sprint could not be found. If the Sprint has already started, then it works.

JIRA 6.0.8 logs:

{noformat}
2013-12-23 16:07:21,648 http-bio-8080-exec-19 WARN pcora 967x707x1 q3xvvt 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/1/pages [web.rapid.sprint.SprintPagesResource] GreenHopper REST method failed with SC = 500 - JiraCopiedServerErrorWebException
2013-12-23 16:07:21,649 http-bio-8080-exec-19 WARN pcora 967x707x1 q3xvvt 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/1/pages [web.rapid.sprint.SprintPagesResource] JiraCopiedRestErrorCollection[errorMessages=[An error occured when storing a JSON property {0}],errors={}]
{noformat}

Workaround:

No workaround available.
fields.summary: Linked Page in Sprints not working
